intro: Gladiolus galiciensis, commonly known as the Galician gladiolus, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Galicia in northwestern Spain. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and red. The plant belongs to the Iridaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
